posts.post_content: Comparable to [Snuff Out](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Snuff Out). Both cards could cost you 4 life. Snuff Out requires a swamp and no mana and Dismember costs no swamp but one mana, or two mana and two life, etc. Idk which is better but I personally prefer this card because hard casting it is a bit easier than hard casting snuff out.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
This card is amazing, but it was a mistake.  
-5/-5 at ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol), even with the condition of 4 life, is simply not acceptable for every color.  
It's intuative, is neat, it's awesome,  
But it's a mistake nonetheless.  
5/5

posts.post_content:
This card is an example of what not to do when designing cards.  
  
It sacrifices color wheel identity just to provide every deck with a easy solution to metagame problems. Instead of FIXING THE PROBLEM with the color pie and the power disparity between colors, you put a bandage over it. Good job Wizards.   
  
Easily the best removal in Standard and possibly Modern. Oh and heres the kicker.  
  
Blue doesn't give a \*\*\*\* about life either.
posts.html:

It sacrifices color wheel identity just to provide every deck with a easy solution to metagame problems. Instead of FIXING THE PROBLEM with the color pie and the power disparity between colors, you put a bandage over it. Good job Wizards.

Easily the best removal in Standard and possibly Modern. Oh and heres the kicker.

Blue doesn't give a **** about life either.
